newsitem.title: KENYA: Nairobi bourse eases after price drop.
newsitem.headline: Nairobi bourse eases after price drop.

text.p: The Nairobi Stock Exchange (NSE) 20-share index eased 5.26 points on Friday after a steady decline in key share prices, brokers and bourse officials said.
"Prices on most shares have dropped and many investors do not want to position themselves as buyers. Like a normal Friday, the market was terribly dull," a broker said.
The index stood at 3033.98 with turnover posted at 5.749 million shillings traded on 146,730 from 10.804 million shillings traded on 268,177 shares on Thursday.
Brokers and bourse officials said the downward movement of prices across the board contributed to the index's decline.
"Once prices start going down, everyone starts selling. After all, it makes more sense to buy from a rising market," one broker said.
"Investors' morale is very low. Kenya Airways is one of those shares where many investors felt they burned their fingers," he added.
Kenya Airways price has declined steadily from an initial offer price of 11.50 to an average market price of 9.50.
Independent analysts said market prices are undervalued due to misconceptions about the extent of political and economic investment risk and a lack of market coverage.
"Investing in the market is a recent phenomenon to the public and understanding it is the key issue here, not necessarily a lack of demand," a senior broker said.
Kenya Airways and Kenya Commercial Bank (KCB) continued to trade actively maintaining foreign interest.
Foreign investors bought 25,000 shares of KCB between 56 and 57.50 and 7,000 shares of Kenya Airways at 11.20.
KCB has been the most active share, trading over 200,000 shares during the week, mainly foreign investors looking to fill their orders.
Total Kenya eased to 66 from 66.50 while Sasini Tea & Coffee shed 1.50 to close at 53.
